subject: Technology
title: OLED and MicroLED: The Perfect Screen
description: A 60-second lesson on OLED and MicroLED: The Perfect Screen.

hook.text: OLED screens turn off individual pixels for perfect black. The contrast makes images look three-dimensional.

buildup.text: Traditional LCD screens use a backlight that's always on. OLED pixels produce their own light, no backlight needed.

discovery.text: With OLED, a dark scene actually goes dark. Stars in a night sky look like real points of light against true black.

twist.text: OLED pixels can burn in. Display a logo too long and its ghost remains permanently. The perfect screen has a flaw.

climax.text: MicroLED promises OLED's quality without burn-in, using microscopic LEDs. It's the next frontier in display technology.

punchline.text: We keep building better screens. Our eyes barely notice the difference anymore.

quiz.question: What advantage does OLED have over traditional LCD?
options: Individual pixels turn off completely for perfect black levels
It uses less energy in all situations
